resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

nealrichardson commented on pull request #5683: ARROW-6918: [R] Make docker-compose setup faster
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5683#discussion_r336064463
 
 

 ##########
 File path: r/Dockerfile.conda
 ##########
 @@ -26,9 +26,30 @@ RUN conda install -q \
         nomkl && \
     conda clean --all
 
-ENV ARROW_PYTHON=OFF \
-    ARROW_BUILD_TESTS=OFF \
-    R_CONDA=1
+# Ensure parallel R package installation and set CRAN repo mirror
+RUN printf "options(Ncpus = parallel::detectCores(), repos = 'https://demo.rstudiopm.com/all/__linux__/bionic/latest')\n" >> /opt/conda/lib/R/etc/Rprofile.site
 
 Review comment:
   I think conda installs R package dependencies separately/differently, so this "repos" arg probably doesn't do anything (well, it definitely doesn't do anything without the `HTTPUserAgent` suggestion I made above, but I don't know that it would matter even if you added it).
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

nealrichardson commented on pull request #5683: ARROW-6918: [R] Make docker-compose setup faster
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5683#discussion_r336066966
 
 

 ##########
 File path: r/Dockerfile.sanitizer
 ##########
 @@ -51,6 +51,17 @@ RUN apt-get update -y -q && \
       tzdata && \
       apt-get clean && rm -rf /var/lib/apt/lists*
 
+# Ensure parallel R package installation and set CRAN repo mirror
+RUN printf "options(Ncpus = parallel::detectCores(), repos = 'https://demo.rstudiopm.com/all/__linux__/bionic/latest')\n" >> /usr/local/RDsan/lib/R/etc/Rprofile.site
 
 Review comment:
   ```suggestion
   RUN printf "options(Ncpus = parallel::detectCores(), repos = 'https://demo.rstudiopm.com/all/__linux__/bionic/latest', HTTPUserAgent = sprintf('R/%s R (%s)', getRversion(), paste(getRversion(), R.version$platform, R.version$arch, R.version$os)))\n" >> /usr/local/RDsan/lib/R/etc/Rprofile.site
   ```
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

nealrichardson commented on pull request #5683: ARROW-6918: [R] Make docker-compose setup faster
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5683#discussion_r336061438
 
 

 ##########
 File path: r/Dockerfile
 ##########
 @@ -64,6 +64,7 @@ ENV LD_LIBRARY_PATH=/opt/conda/lib/:/build/cpp/src/arrow:/arrow/r/src
 RUN printf "options(Ncpus = parallel::detectCores(), repos = 'https://demo.rstudiopm.com/all/__linux__/bionic/latest')\n" >> /etc/R/Rprofile.site
 
 Review comment:
   Unrelated to your changes but this is needed to use the RStudio binary package manager, which will also speed up R dependency installation:
   
   ```suggestion
   RUN printf "options(Ncpus = parallel::detectCores(), repos = 'https://demo.rstudiopm.com/all/__linux__/bionic/latest', HTTPUserAgent = sprintf('R/%s R (%s)', getRversion(), paste(getRversion(), R.version$platform, R.version$arch, R.version$os)))\n" >> /etc/R/Rprofile.site
   ```
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

   Anyway, with this PR, on my machine:
   * `docker-compose build r` takes 5m26s
   * `docker-compose build r-conda` takes 4m50s
   * `docker-compose build r-sanitizer` takes 2m51s

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.

comments.body: https://github.com/rstudio/r-builds could help skip some steps, but I haven't looked at what exactly is slow (I don't personally use docker for R).
